sentences: See vapper Mai hädaldas, et elu on raske olnud.
context: In Estonian, 'seda' is the partitive singular form of the demonstrative pronoun 'see'. It functions as a neuter or gender-neutral demonstrative pronoun used to refer to something already mentioned or understood from context. The word can be translated as 'this', 'that', or 'the mentioned' depending on the specific context in which it is used.
